title: Man facing murder charges in shooting death of teen
content:
8:45 a.m. Tuesday, November 22nd, 2016: An arrest has been made after a teenager was shot and killed on Charleston's East End.
According to Lt. Steve Cooper with the Charleston Police Department, 62-year-old William Ronald Pulliam, is being charged with 1st degree murder in connection to Monday night's shooting on Washington Street East.
The 15-year-old was shot in the abdomen and later died at the hospital.
Pulliam is being held in the South Central Regional Jail without bond.
Stay with 13 News on air and online at tristateupdate.com for the latest developments in the case.
11:58 p.m. Monday, November 21st, 2016
Officers have confirmed that the victim succumbed to their injuries earlier this evening.
The victim was a juvenile and underwent surgery following a shooting that occurred near Nancy Street and Washington Street East in Charleston, WV.
Police are still looking for the suspect in the attached photo and are asking for your help in identifying them.
We will continue to update you as more information becomes available.
10:55 p.m. Monday, November 21st, 2016
Detective Cooper of the Charleston Police Department confirmed that the victim was shot in the abdomen.
They are currently undergoing surgery.
This is following a shooting that occurred around 8:45 p.m. between Nancy Street and Washington Street East in Charleston, WV.
If you recognize the suspect in the photo, please contact police immediately.
Stay with 13 News for the latest information.
ORIGINAL:
The Charleston Police Department is investigating a shooting with injuries that occurred in Charleston at 8:45 p.m. on Monday, November 21st, 2016.
Metro 911 received information that one person had been shot on Charleston's East End, between Nancy Street and Washington Street East.
Dispatch had no information regarding the extent of injuries sustained or the status of the victim.
No arrests have been made at this time.
Stay with 13 News as we continue to update this ongoing investigation.
